document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION

2821ECBAAC2441908E29E33FA4A69411.description: describe how participation in a variety of physical activities builds confidence and increases personal enjoyment.

C20994D0618F449D9A745DD044ABC364.description: develop a plan using available technology to participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity for a sustained period of time on a regular basis; and

98222B7B82874B7BBE3B2F9C1D49B369.description: Lifetime wellness--application of lifetime wellness. The physically literate student identifies the value of lifetime wellness. The student is expected to:

191A3D5625CF420887FE7B434DEFF7D2.description: Social and emotional health--accepting and providing constructive feedback. The physically literate student accepts and provides constructive feedback. The student is expected to analyze feedback to make appropriate changes to improve performance.

332F8C338A924CFEABB4C0829FF69CFB.description: Social and emotional health--perseverance. The physically literate student perseveres while addressing challenges. The student is expected to discuss the importance of accepting individual challenges and demonstrate self-management skills to persevere in a positive manner during game situations and sports.

270278DB288F420780209CEFE10B6D50.description: demonstrate empathy and mutual respect for the feelings of others.

22B3B14F150941F6BEEA63C9888C1524.description: explain and demonstrate effective communication to enhance healthy interactions while settling disagreements; and

B988E06691064A798F1214477268DD04.description: discuss the importance of and resolve conflict, without cue, in socially acceptable ways, and respond to winning and losing with dignity and understanding;

A3C205E964AE4C3D990E0312BE820CC3.description: Social and emotional health--resolving conflict and social interaction. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in resolving conflict and social interaction. The student is expected to:

DC191ED6E7FD469395898483637D1D56.description: apply self-management skills to demonstrate self-control of impulses and emotions, without cue, during games, situations, and sports.

A7E5340B08044F05A77BF29925CC0074.description: explain the importance of and demonstrate respect for differences and similarities in abilities of self and others during dynamic activities and lead-up games; and

265018FE1C294B1FBF97796580A50E36.description: explain the importance of and accept responsibility for personal actions that affect self and others during game situations and sports;

3C5C5425F2F64351A64DBBEA30AAA626.description: Social and emotional health--personal responsibility and self-management. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in personal responsibility. The student is expected to:

34E929530B3341218A56695A44DB8CA2.description: perform, without cue, the correct safety precautions, including water, sun, cycling, skating, and scooter safety.

EDA376F142A04BA2B8FA89BD9E5D1C0A.description: perform, without cue, the selection and use of proper attire and safety equipment that promote safe participation and prevent injury in dynamic activities, games, and sports; and

B953BD13017E481296CEAB512B24A778.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--environmental awareness and safety practices. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in environmental awareness and understands safety practices. The student is expected to:

B1FE5AD5E23D43C9B1195E3BF2C0F8C5.description: identify how environmental temperature and humidity each contribute to dehydration and heat illness.

43F85D4A5846490BB12E25E2A6B40513.description: identify macronutrients, including carbohydrates, fats, and proteins, and examine their relationship to optimal physical performance; and

2B46C660A10742F6B409756DA3D19C8F.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--nutrition and hydration. The physically literate student recognizes the correlation between nutrition, hydration, and physical activity. The student is expected to:Â

BB177365A3204A63BCCBA4F18BAAC1AB.description: analyze results of fitness assessments to identify strategies for self-improvement.

9FF92FE4B502425481173BF339148853.description: develop an individual fitness plan using personal fitness goals; and

BEC90710787C4E3D8C75E26DD90A468B.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--analyze data. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in the ability to analyze data used during fitness performance. The student is expected to:

DEA574B6C79E45D3930D72F4DAF3FDF9.description: describe health-related and skill-related fitness components and their impact on personal fitness.

15B02377AD684D2E9A727FA0375327AC.description: describe the frequency, intensity, time, and type (FITT) principle and how it improves fitness in relation to aerobic and anaerobic activities; and

B2B1D4FEEF23498AA43AE69BBC17349B.description: describe the long-term benefits of moderate to vigorous physical activity on overall health and wellness;

CEB38500F96B41FCA8FB5B8D5FDC6160.description: Health, physical activity, and fitness--fitness principles. The physically literate student demonstrates and recognizes a health-enhancing, physically active lifestyle. The student is expected to:

0A9583D03E654B55A9F9D9ECCECCEBD3.description: Performance strategies--outdoor and recreational pursuits. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in outdoor and recreational pursuits. The student is expected to participate in self-selected, organized outdoor recreational skills, activities, and games.

02DD8C0C13F444A7934EDA13B3BD8CBE.description: demonstrate appropriate sporting behavior with teammates, opponents, and officials.

4FF194E5CC8B4439A07CCBE4DBA22FBA.description: demonstrate combinations of locomotor, manipulative, and game skills in dynamic activities to achieve individual or team goals; and

176454D5BF3B4E5A9BD872455466F550.description: demonstrate offensive and defensive strategies used in net or wall, invasion, target, striking, and fielding games;

50D2271C8565489CB4097331A5AD1902.description: Performance strategies--games and activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in performance strategies in invasion, target, net or wall, fielding, striking, and cooperative games. The student is expected to:

711EBA370AFF4F67BA97CBA2B545664F.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--rhythmic activities. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in rhythmic activities and rhythmic combinations. The student is expected to perform rhythmic routines with intermediate steps and movement patterns.

47FB0D9619B944AAB5AF3037471AF3A2.description: apply speed, direction, and force with a long-handled implement during dynamic activities, games, and sports.

714F3D0F03DC4273BCE5A952E294F1BB.description: demonstrate the appropriate use of open space and closing space during dynamic activities, games, and sports; and

6F8F776BC0FF459CAE31A6DDA807B0DC.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--spatial and body awareness. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in spatial and body awareness including pathways, shapes, levels, speed, direction, and force. The student is expected to:

FD95587016B24617B25A5F9ED1B1CA6C.description: create and perform a jump rope routine using a variety of advanced skills.

B05A9D464010443BAEAAE86AED99C570.description: demonstrate correct technique when striking an object with speed, accuracy, force, and distance using a hand or handled implement during dynamic activities and lead-up games; and

A28BEA5989454DB99C5C10B9A7D5B395.description: demonstrate correct technique in volleying to a target with control and accuracy;

69FE8689EBD3408BA8F2DDE8921EF5BE.description: demonstrate correct technique in kicking and punting with accuracy during dynamic activities and lead-up games;

1C3ADD687CF9408A84C4EDA3E074B059.description: demonstrate correct foot dribbling technique with control while changing both speed and direction during dynamic activities and game situations;

1EC1080B6ADA4D888AD25CDC6E60F9BF.description: demonstrate correct hand dribbling technique when changing both speed and direction while maintaining ball control;

354B553715514280A2FB4A3A40E3CC1C.description: demonstrate correct catching technique from different levels and trajectories with a variety of objects;

86144EA42E884E9CA36DEF08BA4358F4.description: demonstrate correct technique when throwing to a moving target;

B143F48A3C92408CA47E656CDC84A089.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--manipulative skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in developmentally appropriate manipulative skills. The student is expected to:

B389AAA9071F4249AA39C78B1978B22F.description: demonstrate proper body positioning, proficiency, footwork, and offensive and defensive skills during dynamic activities and games.

77704CAC8A0C4420B19B528BFF155C05.description: demonstrate balance with control during dynamic activities and games; and

E192948DD30E4D109AA48C47DFA5820E.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--non-locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate non-locomotor skills. The student is expected to:

C1CEC5A3700344DC8FD0A7ADB5761721.description: demonstrate correct jumping and landing technique during dynamic activities, game situations, and sports.

30554867462840D1BC474AE5E97BFCD7.description: perform a variety of locomotor skills and combinations during dynamic activities and games; and

1041CF606DD342E5856375C2E155D816.description: Movement patterns and movement skills--locomotor skills. The physically literate student demonstrates competency in fundamental movement patterns and developmentally appropriate locomotor skills. The student is expected to:
